items.title: Arsenal go 5 clear in 'great way to end the year'
items.summary: Mikel Arteta labeled Arsenal's 4-1 thrashing of Aston Villa a "great way to end the year," but played down the importance of his team moving five points clear at the top of the Premier League.

items.title: Chelsea defend Palmer sub amid boos at Bridge
items.summary: Chelsea assistant coach Willy Caballero defended the decision to take off Cole Palmer during the 2-2 draw with Bournemouth after supporters at Stamford Bridge reacted furiously to Enzo Maresca's substitution.

items.title: Emery denies Arteta snub after Arsenal beat Villa
items.summary: Unai Emery rejected claims that he snubbed Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta after the full-time whistle in Aston Villa's clash at the Emirates Stadium.

items.title: Wolves draw sums up Man Utd's year: Hope followed by howlers
items.summary: Any momentum generated by Man United's Boxing Day win over Newcastle was brought to a shuddering halt on Tuesday -- this time by the worst side in the division.

items.title: After emphatic win over title rivals, Arsenal can dare to dream once more
items.summary: Concern had been building, but Arsenal's triumph sends them surging into the New Year.

items.title: 'Statement win' - Merson predicts easy title victory for Arsenal after dismantling Villa
items.summary: Paul Merson believes Arsenal will go on to win the Premier League easily after they blew in-form Aston Villa away with a "statement" 4-1 win at the Emirates Stadium.

items.title: Rangers vindt weer aansluiting in Schotland
items.summary: Dinsdag gaat het weer los in de Premier League. Koploper Arsenal ontvangt Aston Villa, dat zich lijkt te gaan mengen in de titelstrijd, en Manchester United neemt het op tegen hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers. Op de Afrika Cup zijn vier potjes, en in Schotland zetten Celtic en Rangers hun achtervolging op koploper Heart of Midlothian voort. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van dinsdag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Amorim legt 'vreemde' Zirkzee-wissel uit na Man United-sof
items.summary: R√∫ben Amorim baalt dat hij het jaar 2025 niet met een goed gevoel af heeft kunnen sluiten . Manchester United beet zich stuk op hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers, dat pas het derde punt van het seizoen pakte op Old Trafford. Ook ging Amorim in op de wissel van Joshua Zirkzee.

items.title: Dundee United climb back into top six with victory at Livingston
items.summary: Dundee United moved back into the Scottish Premiership top six with a deserved 3-1 win at basement side Livingston.

items.title: Bournemouth draw with Chelsea after chaotic first half
items.summary: Bournemouth are winless against Chelsea in their last nine Premier League matches after drawing 2-2 at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Wolves earn shock draw at Man Utd to end losing run
items.summary: Ladislav Krejci equaliser earns Wolverhampton Wanderers their first point since October as they draw 1-1 at Manchester United.

items.title: Arsenal score four second-half goals to thrash Villa
items.summary: Arsenal score four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1 and end the year five points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

items.title: Dundee secure comeback victory over Kilmarnock
items.summary: Dundee came from behind to secure a precious 2-1 victory over Kilmarnock at Dens Park.

items.title: Brighton come from behind twice to draw with West Ham
items.summary: Brighton & Hove Albion come back from behind twice to draw 2-2 with West Ham United in a match that saw three penalties awarded in the first half.

items.title: Garner & Barry score as Everton beat Forest
items.summary: Midfielder James Garner scores and sets up Thierno Barry as Everton condemn his former side Nottingham Forest to a third straight defeat.

items.title: Alleen op papier een topper: Arsenal vermorzelt Aston Villa
items.summary: Arsenal heeft zijn status als titelkandidaat andermaal bevestigd. In de topper tegen Aston Villa was de ploeg van Mikel Arteta heer en meester: 4-1.

items.title: Gabriel Magalh√£es‚Äô opener sparks Arsenal‚Äôs second-half rout of Aston Villa
items.summary: Arsenal will begin 2026 with a five-point lead at the top of the Premier League as they continue their quest for the club‚Äôs very own holy grail, and judging by this game of two halves against putative title rivals they may need it. A scrappy, angst-ridden opening 45 minutes was followed by a performance of complete dominance kickstarted by two goals in the space of five minutes from Gabriel Magalh√£es and Mart√≠n Zubimendi at the start of the second half. Leandro Trossard added a third with 20 minutes to go before the substitute Gabriel Jesus rubbed salt in Aston Villa‚Äôs wounds to compound their first defeat in 12 matches and leave them six points adrift of the leaders in third. items.title: Krejci grabs point for Wolves as Manchester United continue to flounder
items.summary: Manchester United missed eight frontline players so Wolves, who arrived as the bottom team with only two points, seemed ideal opponents. Yet Ruben Amorim‚Äôs side struggled ‚Äì badly ‚Äì and while Bruno Fernandes, Bryan Mbeumo and Harry Maguire headed those unavailable, the display provokes questions regarding United‚Äôs cohesion. In the contest‚Äôs closing phase they were potent only sporadically ‚Äì as throughout. Their opening-half goal was a fortunate one for Joshua Zirkzee, rebounding in off Ladislav Krejci, and after the Czech‚Äôs equaliser just before the interval, Wolves might have recorded a first ‚Äì and famous ‚Äì victory of the season. items.title: Scorende Zirkzee kan pijnlijke misstap Man Utd niet voorkomen
items.summary: Intro

items.title: Guimar√£es adds gloss after Newcastle‚Äôs quickfire start hurts Burnley
items.summary: Bruno Guimar√£es was sprinting towards a euphoric away end in the 93rd minute to celebrate a second Premier League away win of the season, while the home supporters searched for an exit. All the glory was Newcastle‚Äôs, the points that took them up to 10th secured and the performance did not matter. Burnley deserved more but once again were left with nothing, except a feeling of resignation to their fate. Within seven minutes Joelinton and Yoane Wissa had given the visitors a two-goal lead, and ¬≠Newcastle‚Äôs travelling woes looked a distant memory. Considering Burnley‚Äôs own recent form a comeback looked highly unlikely but Eddie Howe‚Äôs side are fragile, not knowing what to do with a lead nor how to control a game against a team who have ¬≠collected two points from 10 games. Josh Laurent‚Äôs volley ignited hope, a flame that was finally extinguished by ¬≠Guimar√£es in injury time. Continue reading...
